body:
Well I found out that milk doesn't actually have Calcium in it, well not the amount of it that the milk producing companies have claimed to say that it does. 

Share with us ploys (like a scam) set by other companies to earn more money
body_tagged:
Well I found out that milk doesn't actually have Calcium in it, well not the amount of it that the milk producing companies have claimed to say that it does. 

Share with us ploys (like a scam) set by other companies to earn more money
title: Ploys set by Companies to Earn More Money

replies.body:
People always sound suprised that compaines do this. They're a company to make money, not make sure you get your daily reccomended amount of calcium. 

Sausages only need to be 5% meat in Ireland.
Pork sausages only need to be 10% pork
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
Agreed. I took a look at some "pork" sausages...

78% chicken.

replies.body:
"Organic"
"Organic products" are only required to have 70% organic ingredients in the US. That may seem like a small allocated percentage (30%) for non-organic material, but it's a matter of what that material is.
Also, hey aux :D
replies.body_tagged:
"Organic"
"Organic products" are only required to have 70% organic ingredients in the US. That may seem like a small allocated percentage (30%) for non-organic material, but it's a matter of what that material is.
Also, hey aux :D

replies.body: Mc Donalds say that their chicken nuggets are made from 100% chicken, not quite. Lets just say you could get very sick if you only ate Mc Donalds chicken nuggets.
replies.body_tagged: Mc Donalds say that their chicken nuggets are made from 100% chicken, not quite. Lets just say you could get very sick if you only ate Mc Donalds chicken nuggets.

replies.body: I wouldn't be so concerned with the percentage of "chicken" in the nuggets so much as what they're passing off as chicken.
replies.body_tagged: I wouldn't be so concerned with the percentage of "chicken" in the nuggets so much as what they're passing off as chicken.
